summary: The Army Corps of Engineers takes on water infrastructure-related civil works projects such as dams, levees, and more. A 2022 law allowed the Corps to use types of contracts for these projects that aren't procurement contracts, cooperative agreements, or grants. These are known as "other transaction agreements." Corps officials said they have drafted guidance for using these agreements. However, they can't finalize this guidance until...
title: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers: Use of Other Transaction Agreements in Water Development Projects
